12421.content:
Michael the Fawn had almost everything he would ever hope to want. He had the newest video games along with the newest consoles to play them on. The deer had around five dressers worth of clothes just waiting to be used. He could spend his whole life in the family mansion library, and it still wouldn't be enough time to read all of its books. The kitchen was stocked with enough food to feed well over a hundred people. He was good at school, straight A's all across the card. Everything about Michael's life was what every boy his age would dream about living.

So...why was he so depressed?

The answer was simple: Michael was lonely. While the small deer's parents were willing to buy him anything in the entire world, they were rarely ever around, too busy at work to entertain their child. The mansion was a prison. It was certainly a nice one with opulent decorations and good food, but still, at the end of the day, a prison it was. The great house was almost always empty save for him, and at first, he didn't mind. He liked his solitude and even thrived on it for a while.

But as time went on, Michael began to come to the painful realization that he was truly alone. He began to feel like a trophy kid, awed by his distant parents and tossed away when no one was around. It began to take a toll on his grades, which is the only time when his parents are ever interested in him. They couldn't have a dumb kid, think of the gossip! They hired a psychiatrist, and another and another, and they all said that he needed more time with his parents...which they just couldn't provide.

So, they turned to the private sector for help and came across Melanie. She had a great reputation as both a nanny and a tutor, loved kids and was well recommended by the rest of their peers...she just had one blemish. Her hunger. Michael's parents agreed that as long as they kept a well-stocked kitchen as per the norm, the little Fawn would be fine. If not...well, it wasn't too much of a loss, was it?

It was on Michael's tenth birthday when Melanie came into his life. He was eating a slice of chocolate cake that his parents had sent for him with his breakfast. On the letter, they said that they would have loved to come, but they found the company at the country club to be too good, and that they hoped he would enjoy his birthday present. That last bit caught him off guard, as there was no noticeable present aside from the cake...perhaps they're losing more interest in him than he thought.

Suddenly, the sound of the front door of the great manor being knocked rang out through the halls, catching him by surprise. He instantly hopped down from his seat and began running towards the main foyer of the house. Perhaps his parents were playing a prank on him! Maybe the birthday present this year was them! He was getting his hopes up, and as he opened the heavy, wooden doors...they died out to confusion.

In front of the entrance to his home was not his two deer parents, but a cow, a very fat and kindly looking cow. She was dressed in a black dress with a white trim that was so tight it left nothing to the imagination, along with a ruffled half-apron, a lace headpiece, and long black and white stockings. A classic french maid. The big bovine looked down at the puzzled fawn and gave a wide smile.

“Hello there, master Michael!” She greeted with a curtsy before picking him up gently from the ground to bring his smaller body into a hug. The ten-year-old deer was not sure what was going on, but he felt compelled to return the embrace as it would be rude not to. His face was pressed right into her bosom, which her dress could barely contain, making him red underneath his fur. “My name is Melanie, and I’m your birthday present!”

Michael managed to wiggle his face out of Melanie’s cleavage just enough to take a deep breath of air. “Uh...u-um, it’s very nice to meet you, Ms. Melanie, but...what’s going on, exactly?” He tried to compose himself as the nanny cow stared back at him with wide, expressive eyes. He felt like he could have fallen into them if he wasn't careful. “And how did you know it was my birthday?”

The fat cow smiled and walked inside the lofty building, shutting the door behind her as she carried Michael in her arms like a baby. “Your parents told me that you were feeling a little lonely, So I’m here to make sure you don't ever have to be alone again! You must have felt so small, living in this big, empty house with no one to share it with.” Melanie made a good effort at making him feel small, too. She leaned her face forward to give rub her snout against his nose. “No one deserves to be alone on their birthday…”

Michael was let down back into the seat he was just in earlier, where his plate of food was still sitting. How did she know where the kitchen was? Yet, despite how chaotic and sudden his birthday morning was turning out, he was...strangely optimistic for it. The Fawn was eager to have someone to play with, to hang out with after being alone for so long! He looked up with a smile at his new nanny, who was...busy raiding his pantry. “O-oh, that’s alright, Miss Melanie, I’ve already ate, see?” He gestured to his plate of scrambled eggs, but the cow just giggled.

“Silly deer, this stuff is for me!” Melanie exclaimed as she hauled out several pre-packaged sweats and foodstuffs her her to chow down on. “The first thing I always do when I move into a new mansion is taste the kind of food that you rich folk can afford~" She winked before setting down her feast of purely dessert food on the other side of the kitchen table. Michael barley touched the rest of his food as he witnessed her eat. She was like a black hole, devouring everything down to the last crumb! It was kind of hypnotizing...

Soon, however, she was done with her little meal, little in the context that it barely filled her up, but it would do for a while. "So, what's the first thing you want to do on your special day?" Michael had planned to just laze about the house all day, but with Melanie, his choices of entertainment had skyrocketed. Michael...

Her second in command, an elephant called Genivive, eagerly took her place the moment it became apparent she never would come back. For years, Zinnia City was a town governed by prey, but ever since Genivive came into power the place has gone under some very drastic changes.

Before Genivive, predators were only allowed to eat one prey per day, now they can eat as much as they want and whenever they want, which has led to the current rise on predator obesity. Home invasion for a quick meal used to be a crime that would land preds in prison, now the sentence was a fine and a warning not to do it again. However, no one ever brings up new changes when talking about their mayor. Those that do aren't seen from after that for some reason...

As the laws for predators became laxer, the predators ate and ate, and the more they ate the more they grow impossibly huge, both up and out. But no one seemed to think that there was a crisis in their city as if it was all normal. And it was normal in a sense, as predators are naturally meant to be big, gluttonous eating machines, but what works in nature and what works in Zinnia City were two very different things. But City Hall was on a rampage of joining the two worlds together, with plans being drawn up and projections calculated and proposals offered, weighed and compared to one another.

In the middle of the first floor of City Hall was the office of the mayor, and in that office sat Mayor Genivive. The massive elephant, quite possibly the most massive women in Zinnia City, was sitting back in her reinforced steel desk chair as she watched the season five finale of Samurai Brawlers. She nonchalantly told her mayoral aide, a little prey mouse called Roger, to prepare her an address to the population she would deliver after lunch had finished later in the day. A pro-prey rights activist had disappeared in a similar way that the former mayor had, and she was expected to express her sympathies to their death.

"Zinnia City mourns the loss of...er, what's his face, and there will be a lot of healing in the coming days and weeks...God, I can't stomach this stuff..." She paused her dictation to grab a full pie of pepperoni pizza from a greasy box, rolling it up in her trunk to shove it into her maw and swallowed it in a gulp. Standing behind to the elephant's side, her aid rigor flinched. The mayor's weight gain had been a sensitive subject in the last few months, having gone from a meager 500 pounds to multiple tons of blubber and lard. She was by far the fattest elected official since the days of the 19th century when political machines solved elections not by the ballot, but by the belly.

The opposition media really loved to keep bringing the political machines bit up whenever they could, but her title as the mayor countered any body shaming smear campaigns. Being an elected official was a very stressful job, or at least that's what the mayoral duckspeakers quaked out, so it was only natural for her to become more indulgent as she relaxed the same way her other predators did across the city. As well, the average weight of predators in ZC had tripled, so her girth was seen as a symbol of her people, and not some voracious monster. But her re-election was coming up, and the prey majority were getting increasingly fed up with their pred mayor.

"Don't worry about the popularity polls." Roger, who also acted as Genevive's campaign manager as well to his other duties. "It's early in the year, we have more than enough time to bring your public image to prey up. I have the draft for a new education bill here, and-" The mouse was interrupted by the elephant's deep belching.

"Wha? Oh, yeah, education is important and all, just leave that on my desk and I'll look at it later." She grumbled as she poked her still hungry stomach. "Why don't you go out and get me some more groceries. And, uh, six bags this time, not three." Roger sighed as he set the official-looking stack of papers down in her desk before exiting the room. Zachery was sitting in the back seat of a long, black limousine that had picked him up from his family home, playing with his favorite plush toy. He was a quiet young rabbit, never trying to earn anyone's ire or contempt, always striving to be agreeable and inclusive. Despite how courteous and polite he was, aside from his parents, he was truly alone, as there was no one else who could keep up with his relentless intellect. He was imaginative yet decisive, ambitious yet private, amazingly curious, but he does not squander his energy.

For the special occasion, Zachery was dressed up in a white polo shirt and black trousers, suspenders going around his torso and a red bow tie above his chest. He had a mop of messy, blonde hair and a splash of freckles on each side of his creamy cheeks. Born with bad eyesight, he complimented his attire with round-rimmed glasses that helped him see his plush better. He loved the little plush toy, despite knowing that it was a mass of cotton and silk. Seeing that perpetual smug smirk on it.'s muzzle always cheered him up.

And Zachery needed cheering up very badly, as of late.

Although Zachery lit up a very brave front, on the inside he was incredibly afraid. He, along with his parents, had left their old home to move out into Zinnia City for a better life. And they had found a better life, making more money, living in a bigger home, eating better food...but the rabbit had to leave all his friends behind. And he was having a lot of trouble making new ones at his school. To cheer him up, his parents entered his name into a contest to see his favorite actress, Gloria, who he had a bit of a puppy love crush on.

They didn't expect him to win, however, it was supposed to be just something that he could hope for. They didn't think that their tween prey son would ever meet up with a fat, hippo predator, regardless of whether they were a famous movie star or not. Nevertheless, he won, and they had dressed him up for the big event, too focused on how happy he was at the prospect of meeting her to properly worry about him getting eaten.

Soon, the long limousine came to a slow stop, and the door to his left was opened by the driver. Zachery began to shimmy his way to the open door, but the driver, a kind looking eagle, politely held up his hand and shook his head. "No no, young man." He chuckled with a knowing look in his eyes. "You're not getting out, She's coming in~" Blushing and squirming with excitement, the blonde, bespectacled rabbit wiggled back to his seat.

They were parked in front of a large mansion, so big it looked like ti could hold five instances of his own home inside with ease. Zachery felt the limo shake slowly, picking up in intensity as time went on before suddenly the front door of the lofty manor was pushed open to reveal...her. His eyes widened at the sight of the icon he had grown up with. She had definitely changed since the showing of that movie all those years ago...but he didn't think he disliked it at all.

The hippo women climbing down the stairs of her mansion was more than twice his height, dressed up in a flowing, white gown held together by some gilded straps, giving the impression of some sort of Greek Deity. The ground shook underneath her monumental weight, with a stomach so large and so round that it almost doubled as a wrecking ball, the straps struggling to hold the sphere of taut flab. Her cleavage bulged out from her clothes heavily, the beginnings of a few tears peppered here and there on her white silk as it wobbled and giggled. The rabbit had already had a precocious crush on the hippo and seeing her now, so much bigger and fuller put butterflies in Zachary's stomach.

Gloria smiled warmly at the little rabbit boy as she clambered into the limousine, the frame tilting to her side despite being built to handle plus sized predators. "My, they never told me that the contest winner was from heaven, 'cause you look like an angel!" Zachery blushed bearded under his fur and let out a stifled squeal of joy as the object of his crush was right in front of him. The Hippo smirked and patted the seat next to her. "What are you doing all the way over there?"

Zachery widened his eyes and eagerly took Gloria up on her offer, wiggling over to her fatty side. He gasped as he felt a heavy weight placed on his shoulders, only to realize that the Hippo had wrapped her arm around him, giving him a little ruffle of the hair. "So, young man, what's your name?" She asked as the limousine started up and rolled away from her mansion. The rabbit smiled nervously, his blush never letting up.

"M-my name is Zachery, Ms. A-Aralia..." he stuttered, making sure to properly address her by her real name. "It's a real h-honor to meet you!"

Gloria widened her eyes for a split second before regaining her composure to pinch the rabbit's cute cheeks. "Haha, it's been a long time since anyone has ever called me by my real name. You must be a real fan if you found that out~" she teased with a wink. "I prefer Gloria nowadays, but I think Aralia will work just for you."

"Oh, t-thank you!" He exclaimed. "So...where are we heading to?" He asked tentatively, to which the Hippo gave a mischievous smile before responding.

141.content: Good choice, but before the story starts, one question remains...are you a boy, or are you a girl?
141.title: Clovis

choices: Joel Dashes To The Window To Exit
Clovis Sits Joel Down For Some Food
One Of The Boat Rental Guys Had Followed Joel
1411.content:
Joel looked out of the window of his taxi cab at the houses on the outskirts of Zinnia City Bayou. The beat up homes and the old, abandoned plantations sat in the background, sorrowful remnants of a long-dead era of history. The otter looked back to the seat next to him where his leather messenger bag lied. His laptop was safely stowed away inside, and it was depressingly the most expensive thing he had seen in the last two hours, including the vehicle he was being transported in.

Joel returned his gaze to the outside of the window, the sights only solidifying his depression further. The dark, looming trees and the remnants of a bygone age of prosperity. He had never known that such a place existed so close to ZC, and it was the perfect place to get away from the hustle and bustle of the crowds. The otter had decided to take his vacation here, the dark catacombs of the swamp. He was an up and coming cultural anthropologist, having just his degree from Zinnia City College.

After doing extensive research on the various societal differences found just in the City alone, Joel made it something of a goal to find out about the lifestyles of various predators. His laptop was his handbook, and his mind was his greatest recording tool of all. The otter's eyes picked up on details that most don't even notice, like how the driver in front of him wasn't used to spend time with the likes of himself. He was a rather gruff, dark-furred skunk wearing overalls and keeping his mouth occupied with a toothpick. "We uh...don't get too much city folk 'round this far down, boy. What brings ya'?" He asked with a southern accent.

"...I'm trying to find people to talk to." He replied both bluntly and vaguely, ironically not really in the mood for conversation, at least with the skunk. Joel looked down back to his messenger bag's seat, covered in filthy stains. The otter couldn't wait to get out of the taxi cab.

'Talkin' to people? That seems like a big waste of a trip to come down here from Zinnia. You can find people everywhere!" The skunk driver replied to Joel with a hearty laugh. Just then, the more mt of the vehicle made a ding. "Here's yer damn stop, boy," he remarked, bringing the taxi cab to a halt. Joel handed him the fee before getting out of the car, slamming the door shut behind him. The otter threw his leather messenger bag over his shoulders as the taxi drove away, leaving him facing a modest, decent enough looking harbor with a fairly small wooden building near an array of rowboats.

The boats of the harbor laid on the murky, green waters of the Zinnia Bayou, the trees laying past in horizon seeming to go on and on forever. The swamp appeared to Joel as almost neverending, like all swamps. Nevertheless, he was here for a vacation from his work at ZCC, and he intended to make the most of it. The otter walked into the hut and saw three prey gathered around in the corner, huddled around an aging cash register just chatting amongst one another. He looked around the store and didn't see anything that would help him unwind, the store consisting of unkept aisles of fishing equipment and snacks. He walked up to the group, consisting of an elderly mouse, an exhausted rabbit in front of the register, and a lively pidgeon behind it.

"Hello, there!" Joel greeted warmly, waving a paw as he interrupted the idle chatter the trio were having. "I was wondering if there was anyplace to stay around here." The pigeon and the rabbit looked at each other, and then at the otter as if he had just escaped from a mental institute. The mouse shrugged and leaned his elbow down onto the counter, looking the newcomer dead in the eye.

"...Are you...you serious?" The old looking mouse asked with caution.

"Uhh...yeah, why wouldn't I be?" Joel responded with another question, starting to feel nervous.

The elderly mouse looked at the rabbit and pidgeon, who in turn looked away. "Well, sir, I take it you ain't from around here. Otherwise, you would have never come down here from ZC. There's a hotel about ten miles north of here if you want a place to stay. I can even pay for a taxi to pick ya' up."

"But...that's too far away, too close to the city!" Joel exclaimed, throwing up his hands in defense. "I came down here to get away from all that...that nonsense! Isn't there anyplace around here to stay?"

The old mouse gave out a sigh and shook his head sadly. "I'll be honest with ya', kid. I used to have a nice little bed and breakfast operating going on around here, but I shuttered that a couple of week ago. The only reason this little hut is still open is because we're on the way from the main road. I sell a nice amount of gasoline and touristy crap. And I'm not about to let some city slicker disappear just because he's a little pent up."

"...disappear?" Joel furrowed his brow, suspicion creeping up on him. "Like what, this place has a ghost story or something?"

The cranky looking rabbit impatiently turned his head to face the otter, coming into the conversation. "It ain't no fucking story, asshole! A cousin of mine rented a boat from this place about two months ago to catch some fish. Two days later, he still didn't come back. Went into the swamp myself, and I only found his boat. I combed the whole bayou for the bastard, and I never saw him again...there's a damn monster in the swamp." Joel didn't know what to say, but he saw that the lagomorph meant every word. His knuckles were clenched and his arm twitched every so often.

"Okay, so...your cousin got lost, but that's all it took for everyone to leave?" Joel asked, not believing that a monster was responsible. Maybe he just got lost, or drowned, but surely not a monster!

"Nope." The old mouse shook his head again. "It took the other six folks to disappear for us to wisen up.

"Six?!" Joel exclaimed, to which the trio just nodded slowly. "...no, you know what? There's no such thing as a monster, and I'll prove it! Gimmie a boat and some equipment, and I'll find this monster for you." The otter slammed a two hundred dollar bills down on the counter. After seeing the generous amount of green on his counter, coupled with the willing and able city slicker from up north, the old mouse gave out a sigh and turned to the others.

"...alright, kid. It's your funeral." He said, shaking Joel's paw and putting the money in the cash register. The otter turned around, still tugging on his bag as he walked towards the store exit. Before he did so, however, the shopkeeper called out to him in a lazy droll. "Don't bother looking for the monster, boy...They'll find you."



Joel gently rowed his boat through the murky waters of the Zinnia Bayou, passing trees and dodging protruding slabs of rock. The otter’s messenger bag was sitting in front of him, clamped shut to make sure no water would destroy his laptop. He wasn’t really paying attention to where he was going, just drifting through the motions of the swamp. Than, he hit something.

Joel’s rowboat made a loud thud as it collided with something, stopping it dead. The otter looked up and saw he had it a very old, wooden dock. But the moment he got on to the dock in question, it became aware to him that it was really more of a porch, a deck to a small hut in the middle of the swamp. “Hello?” He called out, wanting to see if there was anyone present in the vicinity.

There was.

The old wood beneath his feet began to shake soon after he had made himself known. The heavy, wooden door in front of him on the porch suddenly swung open, revealing the fabled monster of the swamp. Joel looked up to see the grinning mug of quite possibly the biggest and fattest aligator he had ever seen! He was dressed up in an unbuttoned, flannel shirt that left his big, bulging tummy in the open, and a pair of jeans that only came halfway up his big, fat ass.

“Howdy there, stranger.” The fat alligator smiled, bringing a scaly hand out to shake the otter’s. “Don’t think I I’ve ever seen you ‘round these parts. The name’s Clovis, what’s yer’s?”

“It’s uh...J-Joel.” The otter stuttered with a bit of a blush. He had always had a thing for guys, especially the ones who were more...healthy, making the interaction with this Clovis incredibly awkward. “Sorry, to intrude, I just didn’t think there would be anybody out here, especially with all those stores about a monster.”

“...monster?” Clovis furrows his brow depressingly. “Geez, is that what people are calling me? Not ‘the man of the Marsh’ or something nice? Man, you eat a few dozen rabbits or so, and people start calling others names.” He patted his big belly absentmindedly, which Joel just noticed has several paw shaped bulges on the surface.

“Ah, where are my manners?!” Clovis suddenly wrapped a fat arm around the otters back and scooted his body inside his hut. “All that rowing must have you starved! Let me get you a bowl of my famous jambalaya, that always warms people up!” Before Joel could protest just the smallest peep, the door behind him was locked shut.
1411.title: There’s A Monster Out There

143.content: And now, the obligatory question... are you a boy, or a girl?
143.title: Orlando

choices: He wants someone to snuggle while he naps, with belly rubs included
He wants to reward her somehow for being such a diligent employee
1432.content:
“Welcome to Orlando’s!”

Jessica has said that lines so many times, it’s just about burned into the front of her brain! Everytime she trotted bravely up to a table dominated by huge, powerful, dangerous predators She was quite literally the lamb in the wolf’s den, always surrounded by predators giving her slim, fit body hungry eyes and licking their lips as she passes by. All the while, she delivers preys just like her and watches them all be toyed with and gobbled up whole. It was definitely an interesting job she has… but one person made it all bearable.

At present, the athletic cheetah was marching another tray over to one of the tables, this time just full of regular food. She was approaching a table that seemed to be taken by a chubby orca man - obviously a predator who’s just gone through their awakening, and is looking to bulk up to be like some of the massive predators he so admired. He had ordered for his waitress to feed his foodstuffs to him individually, as well as provided belly rubs. Often requested by those that came alone, without their own set of friends.

“Hey there, hun! I’ve got a scrumptious buffet right here for ya!” She smiled warmly as she walked up, pulling the lid off of the tray and revealing a delicious-smelling array of scrumptious foodstuffs! He licked his lips looking over it all, rubbing his belly as he hoped to get it big enough to fit quite an array of delicious prey! “Just lean back and relax, hun~! I’ll take care of everything~!”

With that, he just leaned back with a smile, closing his eye and holding his massive maw open. She happily climbed up and sat on his lap, facing him with a little appetizer in her hand - a big, juicy steak! He cooed as she gently slipped it into his maw, and once it was in, he just swallowed it whole, testing the limits of his throat. She snuggled up to his front, rubbing his belly with her left hand as she grabbed more tasty chunks of meat with the other, letting them slip down his throat.

Sure enough, practice seemed to make perfect… and he got better and more confident at swallowing every foodstuff she provided, even as they got bigger and bigger. At first, she just enjoyed her job, rubbing his gut as it grow big and round and stuffed with food, as she more quickly started to slide things down his gullet. Eventually, near the end of the buffet, things started to go a little… south. She had shoved an entire chunk of meat into his mouth, but when she tried to withdraw her hands, they were… stuck…!

“Sir, please, you’ve sort of got a grip on my hands…” She reminds him, feeling her hands get pressed together as they were trapped in the tight embrace of his throat, shivering as he felt just how warm, gross and meaty his slobber was over her hands. Instead of letting her go, though, he only cooed at her flavor… and his throat started to pull her deeper in…! “S-sir, I must remind you that it’s against the restaurant’s policy to devour the - MPH!” She could barely squeak out a protest before she was pulled headfirst into the orca’s maw!

It seemed that he couldn’t help but take in this delicious prey… either that, or he was planning this from the very beginning. Either way, her voice was completely muffled as he grabbed her sides, restraining her arms as he started to swallow her more and more, her small, perky breasts soon sliding into the tight embrace of his stretchy, slobbery maw. Plus, they were in the corner of the restaurant on an off day, so it was unlikely that anybody would even notice! The cheetah girl whimpered, worried this might be it after all…!

Soon, she was reduced to a pair of kicking legs dangling from the orca’s maw, about to slip into his stomach where rescue would be impossible. She just about made peace with her fate… until suddenly, she felt a hand grab her by the leg! In one easy, swift moment, she was dragged from the miserably tight, warm, dark confines of the orca man’s body, back out in the cool, bright fresh air. She blinked, her eyes adjusting to the light… only to see Orlando holding her up by her ankle, before gently placing her onto the other booth.

“Did you read the rules, bud? It explicitly says… no eating staff members!” Orlando chides the orca… and before the customer had any chance to explain himself, the coyote grabbed him by his sides, and lifted him up off the seat. Before he could so much as let out a yelp, the chubby orca was being shoved down the massive, pudgy coyote’s throat while the cheetah girl watched in awe, every gulp taking in a huge portion of the orca’s body until, at last, he had disappeared completely into a massive, round belly for the already fat canine!

He let out a long belch, before turning back to Jessica with a look of satisfaction on his face. “Sorry about that, Jess. I guess we really need to vet these customers more carefully…” He sighs. He always had the cutest look on his face, with those bags under his eyes contrasted with his warm, if lazy, smile, constantly giving the impression of someone who’s tired but cheerful, and most of all, genuine and cuddly. “C’mon, you could use a break. Let’s get you cleaned up, huh?”

She nodded, trying to hide her blush, as she looked down at her fur. She was soaked in that orca’s disgusting slobber, and smelled terrible! She really did need to wash off. So, sure enough, she followed the massive, pudgy coyote back towards the break room, trying not to stare at that huge, round butt as it swayed behind him. Once they were there, Orlando passed her a towel, and she started to dry the slobber off her fur. Deep down, though, what she really wanted was to hang out with the big, cute coyote man who ran their little restaurant, who she’d always been a bit too flustered to talk to much...
1432.title: Close Call with an Orca

144.content:

Andrew has recently begun to gravitate towards smaller prey, drooling at the thought of them. He doesn’t really know why, perhaps it’s the size difference or maybe the power he has over them, in fact he’s already devoured a few. But theres one in particular he’s just met that he’s quite fond of that he might not be able to devour just yet.

Henry has recently taken up devouring prey on the down low, which has added pounds and rounded out his already large frame. He doesn’t care too much for prey, which he now only sees as food for him to devour. 1441.title: Andrew the Lion

14411.content:
I don’t why I take this bus so often. There are tons of predators around here. It’s late and I always hear of cases of predation from larger Predators in regards to prey of my stature, I’m a pretty small red fox. but despite all that, I keep finding myself here.

The bus rolls up and I get on, it’s kinda full, everyone else is rather large. Most pay me no attention, the most I get is a quick stare, and I recognize a few regulars. I go to the back and there’s an empty seat so I take it. I have to kinda hop on and scoot my way over to the window seat. It’s a little high up but I can see out the window. The next two stops are empty but the third has quite a bit of people. I notice one person in particular, in front of everyone is a huge lion.

I mean the other predators are pretty big compared to me but this lion is massive. He’s got a large and arms chest, and a big belly. Seems like he works out, but also enjoys his food. Just looking at him has got me flustered. When the bus stops, he’s the first one on, meaning he’s the first to get to the last empty seat which is right next to me.

Everyone else floods in filling the bus to capacity with people standing anywhere they can. The lions on his phone and doesn’t notice me, he plops down next to me, giving me little space to myself and he leans back a little, slouching sorta, which basically puts his belly on full display. He places a hand on his belly, still using the other for his phone, and taps his belly one finger at a time quickly in succession. I continue to stare and his belly growls which finally breaks his attention away from his phone.

He first lifts his hand off, and then gives his belly a quick pat, then a rub. This is when he notices me staring.

“Oh, sorry didn’t leave you much space did I?”
He says it kinda smugly.
“Uh, it’s fine”
I say quickly and it’s the truth, I kinda like it.
“Cool”
He puts phone away and his belly growls again. I quickly look at it. He chuckles and rubs it, keeping his eyes on me.
“I was actually on my way to get some food”
I don’t know what comes over me but I feel compelled to touch his belly, so I do.
“You sound pretty hungry”
I say as I rub the top of his belly. I look up at him and he seems taken aback. I quickly pull my paw a back
“Oh, sorry, I just-“
“Like i said, I was just on my way to eat”
he puts his arm around me and his massive paw scoops me up and pulls me close to his body. Staring down at me he says.
“And your coming with me”

<a href="https://i.imgur.com/zsM1VqW_d.jpg?maxwidth=640&shape=thumb&fidelity=me dium" target="_blank"><b>A Visual If Anyone Wants It</b></a>

Where does the big guy take you?

Having extensive mechanical augmentations, he can gain and compute a lot of biological information by tasting people, having sex with them, and of course, ‘processing’ their tissues in his powerful stomach. 15.title: Bonus Ferals

choices: He's bloated and looking to let some gas fly from any end.
He has indigestion and has to go #2.
153.content:
Another hunt, another coin to add to your wealth, and another head will roll afterwards. That was always the first thing you thought about when you went through the bounties on the board. While bounty hunting was dangerous, the reward made up for it, the lowest you ever seen being over a hundred grand. The bounties ranged from escaped convicts to people that tried to skip out on their debts, but the really juicy ones were the ones that had you chase after predators, your favorite being feral preds. Predators were common in society as it ignored whose species were better and treated everyone as food equally, even among other predators. But the feral ones were the most dangerous, as they weren't feral folk that looked like regular animals, but were predators that devolved to mindless beasts that would devour anything that moved. One couldn't reason with them and they had no choice but to flee, hoping they would not be on the menu.
It was quite amazing that a hamster of your size would be able to take down three of them and one that around four feet tall. You've been a bounty hunter for a couple of decades and because of your greed and you moving around, you're still single. But then again, being a bounty hunter has its dangers of you dying and death is usually around the corner. Going through a bunch of bounties, you notice one and take it down.
Your face splits into a grin as you had a bounty for a feral pred wolf, in both senses. Unlike the other ferals you took down or saw, this one had a cybernetic eye and a few mechanical parts here and there. Reading into the description of the target, Paris the wolf held an unbelievable amount of eaten under his belt, that your eyes bulged out at the number. But the amount offered for his arrest soon brings back your confidence and a week later, you were searching for Paris's whereabouts in a desert he was last seen. However, after a few days, you were annoyed at your lack of success.
"Where the hell is that bloody mutt?!" You mutter under your breath and you continue on until night fell.
With no sign of a building to stay at and uncertain of who may come your way, you made your way to some massive boulders and prepared to sleep lightly. It didn't take much for you to fall asleep, as your head hit the pillow and your body sinks into the furry gray boulders.




"Da fuck!" You shouted, scrambling as far as you can from the 'boulder' and eye it widely.
While it looked like a massively long rock, at the end of it, after a good look, it was an impressively massive and very well rounded rump. That said rump soon gets up and its owner was staring at you in curiosity. It was undoubtedly Paris, however, your information failed to mention he was far bigger than the usual wolf. You'll even bet with your life that he was twice as big as an elephant. Speaking of big, his gut hung a couple inches from the ground, a feat that's amazing for his size and a horror at the number of lives he has eaten. However, the information about him being cybernetically augmented seemed to be true, as his right eye was a visor, his left fore leg a limb of machine, an ear replaced by a satellite dish and patches of him having a metallic part welded into his flesh.
"Didn't expect to conduct an experiment tonight. Better wait for the morning," he said before he tried to go back to sleep, you in disbelief at what he said, rather than that, hear him talk.
Wasn't he a feral? But if he wasn't, then why would he devour so many lives then?
"W-wait for just a minute here! I get predators have their thing, but you're just eating everything in sight like a mindless beast!" You shouted, confusion not fully gone.
Paris turns back to you and sighs loudly.
"It's late and I would like to sleep, but to answer your question, it's for science." "Science?" You asked dumbly, but anger starts to rise up.
"Yes, science! It's how we, as a society has grown. The E=mc equation was discovered by Einstego and Marie Ant, on her radiation research. Those two and many more scientists had contributed to our growth of a civilization. Without science, we would still be doing work that can be easily done with science!" He said frantically, panting heavily.
"You are sciencing what exactly?" You ask, your anger and confusion gone, but a dread enters you.
"I can't reveal all my secrets to you, especially a stranger~. Anyways, to ensure my research goes well, I have to taste, fuck, and then 'process' everyone so I can get the results I need. Of course, I need equipment and I can't lug it all around with me, since so many 'disapprove' of my methods, so I altered myself through machinery. Thanks to this, I've gained the ability to absorb the biological information of people through oral consumption and mating, 'processing' them into gut filler. I've also have a few abilties as well," Paris explains, switching his size, anthro and feral forms, and gender.
"But, honestly, I prefer this form," Paris replies, coming back to the same form you found him in.
"You're insane!" You answer back and Paris chuckles at this before his fat stomach visually rumbles violently.
"Um, can I ask you for a favor? My stomach has been acting up like crazy and it somewhat hurts," he asks sheepishly, his tail waggling behind and creating a mini gust.
"Sure," you sigh, the bounty no longer enticing you to continue in hunting him.
What is his problem?
153.title: Paris thegluttonous mad scientist

choices: "Will you allow me to temporarily use you to satiate my hunger?"
"Do you know of a nearby individual who might be of some use to my experiments?"
"Do you have the means to procure me something to eat?"
1533.content:
Paris visibly brightens, his tail sweeping energetically from side to side, "Good! Good! Now, I'm actually uncertain as to the nature of my issue."
          You blink, shock and confusion rendering you mute for a few moments before you manage to ask, "You mean that you don't know what is wrong with your own body?"
          "Unfortunately, a side effect of heavily augmenting oneself with mechanical parts can lead to one not being certain as to the nature of some issues," Paris replies as he glances away from you, "That being said, I can determine the 'symptoms' of my issue."
          You find yourself sighing, then waving a paw at him, "Do tell, I guess."
          "My stomach region has been repeatedly making a gurgle-like sound, experiences a hollow, tightening-esqe sensation, and occasionally pesters me with a mild ache to dull pain. Does this sound familiar to you?"
          You stare at him, your jaw going slack. Was he serious? "Um, yeah. Could you answer a question for me?"
          "Potentially. Ask."
          "When you..." you pause for a moment, then decide to use Paris's own words, "taste and process something, does your body actually put it to use?"
          Paris tilts his head, as though he found your question odd, "Of course. That is a part of 'processing.' Why do you ask?"
          "I'll explain in a moment. One more question. When was the last time you... uh, experimented on something?"
          "Several days prior to our present meeting," Paris states, as though he was simply talking about an experiment in a lab and not wanton eating of everything that existed for a dubious purpose, "Will you explain why you are asking these questions?"
          You nod, disbelief painting your face, "You're hungry."
          "Hungry?" Paris murmurs the word as though it was the first time he'd heard it, "Hungry... Of course. My experiments have the convenience to double as food to maintain my body's faculties. If I stop experimenting, I shall starve... Hmm, it is most distracting, as well."
          You shake your head. He honestly seems to not have realized he had been accidentally starving himself, "Well, now that you know that."
          "A moment. I'd like to ask you for one more favor. Or, rather, an extension of the prior favor."
          You sigh, "What is it?"
          Paris gives you another sheepish look, then murmurs,
1533.title: Just hungry and a little absentminded

15331.content:
You stare at him again, not entirely sure you heard him right, "What was that?"
          "Perhaps simpler terms might help. I would like to swallow you for the time being. Until I find a suitable replacement."
          You blink, then shake your head. Taking a step back, you level a finger at Paris's stomach, "I'm not falling for that. I know full well how that story ends for a hamster like me."
          Paris gives you a grim chuckle, "Allow me to rephrase, then. I will be eating you until I procure a suitable replacement. You may submit willingly, or I will chase you. There is no refusing."
          Without a second thought, you turn on your heel and began to book it. Behind you, another chuckle rang out, "A chase? Very well," the thuds of the wolf's titanic paws began to sound out, spurring you to run faster.
          What happened next could be best described as you both failing miserably. As excepted, it was pathetically easy for Paris to outrun you. However, his hunger proved to be taxing him more than he realized. His strength spontaneously gave out, sending the colossal wolf crashing on top of you.
          You give a grunt as some part of the wolf crashes onto you. When the two of you come to a stop, one of Paris's legs is pinning you down. The wolf gives a groan, "That was unexpected. But, it achieved my goal, I suppose."
          You futilely attempt to push Paris's leg aside, then fix him with a glare. The wolf decidedly ignored it as he studies you, "Shall I repeat my proposition?"
          "What?"
          The wolf chuckles, "My proposition. You temporarily reside in my stomach while I seek out something to properly eat."
          You shake your head again, "I already told you, I know how that ends. I die and join the fat that is your belly."
          Paris nods, "Under normal circumstances, that would be correct. You'd be excellent research material. However, there are two reasons I do not wish to carry that out, as of yet. Do you know them?"
          You scowl, thoughts bouncing from answer to answer, but finding nothing, "No."
          Paris chuckles again, offering what might have been a smile, "Firstly, you alerted me of my hunger. Had you not done so, I likely would not have realized it. Chance alone would have dictated my survival. Secondly, I make my home in this desert. While a perfect place to avoid being disturbed, for the most part, subjects for my research are lacking. I need an assistant who can obtain such subjects. Given your presence, I deduced that you could do so."
          You stare at him for a few more moments, then cautiously ask, "Hold on. If I say yes and let you... let you eat me, what am I really agreeing to?"
          "Simple. I shall swallow you. With your presence in my stomach, it shall halt its distractions, allowing me to properly search for a subject. Upon doing so, I shall release you and begin my experiment on the actual subject. Afterwards, I shall insist that you serve as my research assistant. In doing so, you would be required to assist me in my research, primarily in locating and obtaining subjects for my experiments. Is this agreeable to you?"
          You sigh, then mutter, "If I refuse?"
          Paris gives another chuckle, this one grimmer, "I shall swallow you regardless. However, everything shall continue as I described, anticipating the event that you change your mind."
          "And if that doesn't happen?"
          "In that case, I have already mentioned that you would make for an excellent experiment. Now, your answer?"
          "Hold on. You know what happens if you swallow me, right? There likely won't be enough of my to... let go by the time you find something else."
          Paris nods again, "Of course. Under standard conditions, you would be correct. However, in anticipation for situations where modifying the potency of stomach acid might be necessary, I possess several augmentations that allow me modify the pH of my own stomach acid. Simply put, I am capable of reducing the acidity of my stomach's acid. Your survival will not be in any danger. Now, your answer."
15331.title: The Mad Scientist's Proposition

153311.content:
In the end, Paris had managed to convince you to say yes. All in all, it hadn't been all too bad. Though, you hadn't had to deal with the scientist's stomach for all too long. Through a combination of Paris's size (and speed) and your knowledge of the local area, the larger-than-elephantine wolf managed to find himself a test subject rather quickly. What proved difficult was getting you out. He managed it, of course, but both you and Paris learned that Paris really did not like having to cough stuff up.
          But that was several months ago. Since then, things have been rather pleasant,
even if Paris still had yet to tell you what he was researching. True to your word, you began to act as Paris's assistant and, much to your pleasure, you found that you could also continue your bounty hunting. So long as you made sure to bring something back to prove the target was dead, you could claim the bounties. As for what happened to your targets... Sometimes, you took care of it. Other times, you were able to be both a bounty hunter and research assistant by getting your target to follow you to Paris. And then there were those two targets where you got Paris to go to them. Now that had been a sight to see.
          Paris himself was just as strange as always. He was somewhat blunt and had a tendency to sound like he was ordering a servant when he was telling you to do something. That being said, he sometimes seemed to have something resembling an interest in your current state. When you mentioned sleep at one point, he show you a little place (it was literally just somewhere to sleep when he felt like it) that he off-handedly mentioned you could use, should you require it. It was now home to a small garden (courtesy of Paris) that would eventually provide a small harvest. Small, but it would be enough for a singular herbivore like yourself.
          However, things have been a bit different these past couple days. You have been bedridden due to a rather nasty illness. It was something like the flu, but it certainly felt worse. Paris himself has been busy doing... something? He'd been in and out, working on whatever it was that peeked his fancy. At least, that's what you assumed until yesterday. Yesterday, you overheard Paris muttering to himself. Something about it not being right or something (or someone) not dying on him. Or course, you could easy figure out who Paris had been talking about. It also explains your current situation.

          Paris (currently in a relatively you-sized anthro form) presses a cup into your hand-paw, "Drink this."
          You give it a sniff. It smelled like chemicals and just a hint of mint, "What is it?"
          "Medicine. It should cure you, given a couple days of rest. It also includes an agent that encourages sleep. You've been restless and having trouble sleeping since this started."
          "Will it work?"
          "I'm 95% certain of it," Paris replies, not unlike he normally does.
          You shake your head and down the liquid, wincing at its flavor, "Mmm, tasty... You know, Paris. Keep stuff like this up and you might just convince me that you care about me."
          It didn't take long for Paris's medicine to take effect and for you to pass out. After assuring himself that, yes, you are asleep, Paris looks you over, thinking. He sighs, "I care about you? To be honest, I should have just been done with you months ago. Would have advanced my research and you wouldn't be distracting me from said research. But... Your wit. Dry humor. The fact that, when I let you go, you kept your word and didn't just vanish on me. You aren't even bothered about being near me in my preferred form anymore. So, do I care about you?" He paused, then chuckled to himself,
153311.title: Minor Time Skip

choices: Support Paris. His goal is now your goal.
Doubt Paris. The costs are too much for an uncertain end.
1533111.content:
He shook his head, disbelief ruling his thoughts, "I do. I really do care about him..." he found himself looking back at you, at your relatively peaceful face. After a moment, he turns and makes his way out. After all, he still had research to do.

          You manage low groan as your awareness returned. Slowly, you allow your eyes to open, revealing the cave ceiling. When you turn your head to look around, you are greeted by a sleeping Paris. He is in his feral form again, but much smaller than normal. Hesitantly, you manage to ask, "Paris?" When the wolf failed to awaken, you decide against waking him. No need to disturb his rest.
          After a moment, you notice something. You felt better. Not by much, of course. You certainly still doubt you were up to getting out of bed. But you nonetheless felt a little better, "Paris's medicine, probably. Tasted nasty, but the wolf knows his stuff."
          "I'm a scientist," Paris mumbles, surprising you, "I'm supposed to know my stuff," the wolf rises, yawning and stretching. After a moment, he turns back to you, "From your comment, I take it that your illness has abated?"
          "A little. Still feel like crap," you reply, offering a thin smile.
          Paris eyes you for a moment, then nods, "Alright. Come nightfall, I'll make you another dose. Should do the trick. If not, another after that will."
          You find your grinning again, "Aw, you really do like me."
          Paris rolls his non-visored eye, "Yes... I like you. Now, I will go attend to my research. You stay here and... and get better. No dying, do you hear me?"
          "I hear you. Go, do your research. Speaking of, can you tell me what your research is yet?"
          Paris hesitates, then nods, "I suppose I can do that. I am attempting to develop a means to resurrect those who are devoured."
          You stare at him for a moment, before cautiously asking, "You are doing what?"
          "I am cataloging the biological data of everyone I taste, fuck, and "process" to ascertain whether or not it is possible to bring them back. Preferably via some form of regeneration," Paris returns your stare, his eyes unblinking and absolutely serious, "If that means eating an excessive number of subjects, so be it."
          You blink, then blink again. You're not entirely sure how to respond to Paris's admittance. On one paw, it was certainly for a good purpose. Being able to eat people, but they'd be able to come back. On the other paw... just how many people would Paris have to eat for his research to come to fruition. If it ever did. Would you be among that number, eventually? He always does seem to put his research first...
1533111.title: Paris's Plans

choices: Some time has passed. You are on the hunt.
The next day. You are still sickness-ridden, but feeling better.
15331111.content:
After a few moments, you heave a sigh, "I'm going to get a bounty on my own head doing this, but what the hell? You only live once, after all."
          "What was that?" Paris tilts his head, clearly not certain what you were on about.
          "Whatever you need to achieve your goal, just let me know Paris. I'll do what I can."
          The wolf nods, something akin to relief crossing his face, "I'm glad to hear it. I'm very glad to hear it. Right now, I need you to recover from your illness. You're of little use bedridden."
          You offer a huff, "Yeah, yeah. I am. Now, get moving. You have research to do," you wave Paris away. Taking your words at face value, the wolf meanders off, leaving you alone in the cave. For a moment, you wait to make sure Paris has left, then mutter, "I must be getting soft. Decades of hunting and killing people for money and food, then I just fall in line to Paris, of all people. Though, I suppose he isn't the worst guy to hang around... Ah, I'm too sick to think about this now. Maybe when my head isn't so groggy."
15331111.title: For Science! One has Become Two!

choices: Hmm. Not really. Want this one, Paris?"
153311111.content:
You charge through the street, shoving a female dog out of your way. Frankly, you are pissed. Though not at the three goddamn coyote after you. You are pissed at yourself for fall for their trap.
          Shoving past a fox and her daughter, you mutter to yourself, "This is fucking why I only take police-offered bounties. Half the fucking civilian bounties are fucking fake. But nooo! Had to take the fucking vigilante fucking detective one."
          The object of your current frustration was rather simple. When there was an outlaw that law enforcement struggled to catch, they'd offer a bounty. Said bounties were very thorough, providing just about everything about the target the police could offer. Species, size, gender, predation habits. You name it, they had it (though it wasn't perfect, as Paris proved. He was, after all, a wanted criminal). However, some bounties didn't involve the police. These were the civilian bounties. As expect, they were bounties put up by general civilians. They typically were for petty reasons, provide shit's-worth of information, and half the time were just some predator looking to get an easy meal out of a would-be bounty hunter. Yet, for some fucking reason, you decided that a rather detailed bounty from a private detective was perfectly fine to go for. Of course, the bounty said no-fucking-thing about your target (singular) being identical fucking triplets.
          You take a left down an alley. With any luck, you lost them in the crowd. Even if you didn't (they are coyotes after all), you knew of somewhere where you could hopefully turn the tides. Further down the alley, you take another left, stopping at a ramshackle door. Pulling it open, you charge down the small staircase into a small basement. The place looks exactly how it looked when you moved out a year ago.
          After that quite note, you spin about and position yourself at the bottom of the stairs. They'll have to come down one at a time and you are fairly confident that you can handle them like that. Just as the thought crosses your head, the door at the top of the stairs opens.
          "What are you doing, trying to die out here?" You freeze, staring at the figure that comes striding down the stairway. The rather tall, heavy-set, anthropomorphic figure with grey fur and cybernetic augmentations dressed in a hooded jacket and jeans.
          "Paris?! What are you doing hear?"
          The scientist taps his visor, "My augmentations need maintenance from time to time. I was getting a few replacement parts and saw you fleeing with several coyotes on your tail. Given we have a working relationship that I'm not keen on dismissing, I came to offer my assistance."
          You sigh, but give him a nod, "Fine. Those coyotes are my bounty. Never said anything about fucking three of them."
          Paris chuckles grimly, a sparkle catching his eye, "In that case, perhaps it's time I do an experiment. You hide over there," he gestures to a small, empty bookcase, "And I'll just do this," with the announcement, Paris's form changes, soon take a feral shape (though smaller than his usually size, he is still quite big). After a moment, he turns his head to the door, "Now we wait."
          About a minute later, you hear voices, "This it?"
          "Smell goes here. Along with wolf."
          "Three on two? We've got this."
          The door bust open and three coyotes barrel down the stairs. You're honestly surprised that they just charged. No hesitation, no looking and preparing. They just charge down. And one charges directly into Paris's open mouth.
          Snapping his jaws shut, the wolf begins to flick the coyote about, hmming to himself every now and then. As he is doing this, he catches a second coyote with his paw, leaving you to tackle and restrain the third.
          A resounding gluck causes you to glance over at Paris. The wolf grunts and mutters, "Could taste better. Certainly not worth my time... Hmm, A- blood, is it?" Even as he made his analysis, Paris spat something out before busying himself with swallowing the second coyote (which, though it fought and struggle, was no match for Paris's size and strength). A glance told you that Paris had spat out an paw. Proof of your bounty.
          As Paris began to taste his second victim, you look over the third. What to do with him?
          "Something the matter?" Paris questioned, spitting out half a leg.
          "Just thinking about if I'm hungry or not.
153311111.title: Hunting Partners

info.brief_description: Living in Zinnia City, you happen to fall in love with someone on the gluttonous side.
info.description:
While much of vore consists of 'grab-and-gulp' type relations between predators and prey, I always thought it would be interesting to explore deeper relationships between preds and would-be prey. Major themes of this interactive thus include feederism, weight gain, and the sheer power imbalance of relationships between predators and those significantly weaker than themselves. While it isn't prohibited for the main character to end up being eaten, the focus should be on more 'voyeuristic' vore; aka feeding predators other prey. Characters from movies, tv shows, and games and such can be included, so long as they largely aren't human.

How the City Works: Zinnia City consists of creatures of all shapes and sizes, primarily anthros, but also including talking ferals, robots, and other creatures. It's down its best to accommodate the predatory nature of many of its citizens, and eating other people isn't illegal so long as you don't go overboard. However, it's still enough to make other would-be prey afraid of you, so most predators prefer to keep it a secret to avoid social ostracization.
